intro: Pleragina, commonly known as the ghost flower, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Campanulaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central and South America. Pleragina species typically grow in high-altitude environments, often in rocky or alpine habitats. Due to their rarity and unique appearance, they are of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
